name: Aladdin's Lamp
lore: "I have come in response, what do you want me to do? Just say it. I am your servant, and the servant of the lamp's master, acting according to your command." — One Thousand and One Nights

effect.description: At the start of battle, there is 50% chance for a back row Luminary to randomly gain one of the following: [Attack Boost], [Crit Up], or [Attack Speed Boost]

treasures.name: Sultan's Turban
treasures.lore: "The Sultan immediately noticed that Aladdin's attire and accessories far surpassed his own, and was deeply astronished. Aladdin exuded an air of elegance and refinement, with a dignified aura surrounding him." — One Thousand and One Nights

treasures.name: Flying Magic Carpet
treasures.lore: "Speaking of this silk carpet, it is indeed extraordinary. It is actually a flying carpet, and whoever sits on it can fly wherever they wish." — One Thousand and One Nights

treasures.name: Wishing Ring
treasures.lore: "As he rubbed his hands, he inadvertently brushed against the ring on his index finger, and a straight-standing Genie appeared before him, speaking in a loud voice." — One Thousand and One Nights

name: Eye of Horus
lore: "I am Horus... My actions are as swift as an eagle. I am Horus, I can spread my wings and fly into the sky, then take a seat on the sacred boat that sails on the primordial chaotic waters under the command of Ra." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

effect.description: Increases Critical Rate of allied mid-row Luminaries by 150.
Increases both Crit and Crit Resist by 45

treasures.name: Pharaoh's Scepter
treasures.lore: "I come to you in the form of the sacred falcon, I board your ship. I hold the scepter and issue commands... I board your ship unimpeded, and I sail safely with you to the beautiful west." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

treasures.name: Eagle God Mask
treasures.lore: "Now he has left Horus among the living. He has wings like those of a vulture, and his two wings are like the wings of Horus. He has already armed himself with various Magic Powers." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

treasures.name: Guardian Statue
treasures.lore: "Ah you, eternal god, the one and only god! Great eagle flying with the rising sun!... Your eternally youthful image flashes across the heart of heaven's river." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

treasures.name: Mark of Law
treasures.lore: "Hear me, you remarkable gods, I am nurtured by the Nine Gods... With the help of the falcon, I have arrived at the place where I have a seat, I have reached the gates of heaven." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

name: Golden Fleece
lore: "Under the branches lush with leaves hangs Aeetes' Golden Fleece, fiercely guarded day and night by the Highwyrm." — Argonautica

effect.description: At the start of battle, front row Luminaries gain a Shield equal to 15% of their max HP, lasting for 15 seconds.
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Effect range is expanded to all allied Luminaries

treasures.name: Giant's Core
treasures.lore: "When the Heroes arrived to dock at Crete, the bronze Talos shattered the stones on the Hardness cliffs to prevent the Heroes from trying their ship to this land." — Argonautica

treasures.name: Sleeping Potion
treasures.lore: "The scent emitted by the potion enveloped the Wyrm in sleep. It closed its jaws and stretched its round body far into the Dense Forest behind." — Argonautica

treasures.name: Argo's Figurehead
treasures.lore: "A beam imbued with divine power was installed on the ships. This beam was originally cut from a great oak by Athena and placed at the center of the ship's glow." — Argonautica

treasures.name: Nurtured Dragon Tooth
treasures.lore: "The stars in the sky shone brightly through the night, and the warriors emitted the same brilliance as they emerged from the earth." — Argonautica

name: Heimdall's Horn
lore: "He raised the horn high, blowing loudly for Heimdall. The ash tree standing tall, that is the world tree, trembles." — Poetic Edda

effect.description: When our frontline Luminaries cast their Overdrives, they gain a Shield equal to 18% of their max HP for 6s and gain [Attack Boost]. This can be triggered up to 3 times per battle.
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
Trigger attempt limit increased to 5 times
Shield strength coefficient is increased by 3%
When triggered, grants allies within a large circular area [Attack Boost] and [Damage Reduction Up]

treasures.name: Golden Rooster Status
treasures.lore: "The 'Golden Crown' Gullinkambi raises its head and sings, warning the gods of the Aesir. The spirits in the Hall of Valhalla are awakened by its song." — Prose Edda

treasures.name: Divine Steed's Mane
treasures.lore: "There were many people attending the funeral at that time... Heimdall came driving the Giltop horse... and many frost giants and mountain giants also came" — Prose Edda

treasures.name: Horned Giant Helmet
treasures.lore: "He resides near the Rainbow Bridge in Himinbjorg. He is the guardian of the gods, sitting at the end of the sky, guarding the bridge against the ambush of giants." — Prose Edda

treasures.name: Hofund
treasures.lore: "There is also an Aesir god named Heimdall. He is also known as the god of light... His sword is named Hofund." — Prose Edda

name: Holy Grail
lore: "The Holy Grail, covered with white silk, floated into the hall... Instantly, before each Knight, appeared a feast of wines and delicacies never seen by mankind. After making a round before Galahad's Round Table, the Holy Grail vanished." — Arthurian Legend

effect.description: At the start of battle, if a back-row Luminary has Overdrive Energy Consumption great than or equal to 4, reduces their Overdrive Energy Consumption by 1
When a friendly Luminary activates their Overdrive, reduces your Overdrive Cooldown by 1 second
When an allied Luminary activates their Overdrive, reduces this Sacred Treasure's Overdrive Cooldown by an extra 0.5 seconds
When an allied Luminary activates their Overdrive, reduces this Sacred Treasure's Overdrive Cooldown by an extra 0.5 seconds

treasures.name: Galahad's Round Table
treasures.lore: "The maiden holding the Holy Grail slowly approached and said to everyone: Galahad will take a seat at Galahad's Round Table and obtain the Holy Grail. He will become a Knight more excellent than his father." — The Death of King Arthur

treasures.name: Round Table Roster
treasures.lore: "King Arthur commended all the Knights and instructed them: Never be arrogant, never kill the innocent, never betray... Those who violate will be sentenced to death." — The Death of King Arthur

treasures.name: King Arthur's Golden Crown
treasures.lore: "Regardless of wealth or poverty, everyone kneels as Arthur presents the sword to the altar. The Bishop personally ordains Arthur as the noblest Knight of the time, followed by the coronation ceremony." — The Death of King Arthur

treasures.name: Holy Bomb
treasures.lore: "First, pull out the holy safety pin. Then count to three... Throw your Saint Antica grenade a high towards the enemy, and make those who wreak havoc before my eyes pay the price." — Titancoil and Holy Grail

treasures.name: Axe of the Green Knight
treasures.lore: "The valiant knight is clad in green from head to toe, even his hair matches the color of his steed... In the other hand, he wields a fearsome axe... The broad blade is polished to a shine, as sharp as a razor." — Sir Gawain and the Green Knight

treasures.name: Excalibur's Scabbard
treasures.lore: "The fairy happily said, 'Alright, please take that small boat and row to the center of the lake to retrieve the sword and Excalibur's Scabbard. As for the gift I desire, I will naturally ask for it when the time comes." — Le Morte d'Arthur

name: Mjolnir
lore: "When the Mjolnir was raised, the frost giants and mountain giants suddenly understood — it all made sense, for with that very hammer, he had slain so many of their kin and friends." — Prose Edda

effect.description: When an enemy Luminary releases an Overdrive, Thor the Thunder God immediately descends onto the battlefield and throws Mjolnir at them, dealing 600% of Wyrm Attack as Magic Damage and applying 2s of [Stun]. This effect triggers every 30s and can occur up to 2 times per battle. Skills interrupted by Mjolnir will refund half of the Overdrive Energy Consumption and 8s of skill cooldown.
Trigger attempt limit increased to 3 times
Trigger attempt limit increased to 4 times
Maximum trigger count increased to 5 times. Skills interrupted by Mjolnir will no longer refund Overdrive Energy Consumption and Cooldown

treasures.name: Branch of the World Tree
treasures.lore: "There is also an ancient ash tree named Yggdrasil. Enormous and towering, it divides the heavens, earth, and the underworld, with its gnarled roots reaching deep into the earth's layers." — Poetic Edda

treasures.name: Serpent Hook
treasures.lore: "He pulled the titancoil onto the ship's side, and Thor stared straight into the titancoil's eyes, while the titancoil also fixed its gaze on him, continuously spewing venom from its mouth." — Prose Edda

treasures.name: Endless Cup
treasures.lore: "And when you drink from the horn, it only diminishes a little. It's bottom is connected to the ocean, but you cannot see it. When you reach the shore, you will find that the sea level has dropped significantly." — Prose Edda

treasures.name: Thunder Helm
treasures.lore: "At this point, the Aesir were certain that the builder among them was indeed a giant. They did not keep their oath and instead called upon Thor. Thor came immediately and 'paid' the builder his due." — Prose Edda

treasures.name: Iron Grip
treasures.lore: "His third Treasure of such value is the iron gloves, without which he cannot grasp the handle of Mjolnir." — Prose Edda

treasures.name: Belt of Strength
treasures.lore: "The second Treasure he possesses is Megingjord, and when he fastens this belt, his strength is increased by double." — Prose Edda

name: Orpheus Lyre
lore: "The Thracian poet sang such songs. His singing attracted many trees, enchanted the beasts, and even the stones followed home" — Ovid, Metamorphoses

effect.description: Instantly restores 12% of their max HP to the 3 Luminary allies with the lowest HP percentage, triggering once every 30s
Apply a [Physical Defense Up] to your first target
Apply [Magic Defense Up] to the primary target
[Physical Defense Up] and [Magic Defense Up] effects apply to all targets

treasures.name: Siren's Horn
treasures.lore: "The Sirens are always exploring the distance from a vantage point in a fine harbor, and have already deprived many of their sweet homecoming, leaving them to gradually weaken. At this moment, they also unabashedly sing their delicate songs to the Heroes." — The Argonautica

treasures.name: Ode to Love
treasures.lore: "Orpheus, the birds and beasts, the trees and stones that often come to hear you sing, none of them are without tears for you. The leaves on the trees fall, as if expressing grief." — Ovid, Metamorphoses

treasures.name: Tears of Parting
treasures.lore: "He met the Ruler of this eerie land, the King of he Underworld. He played the harp: The reason I am here is to find my wife. She accidentally stepped on a snake, which bit her and took away her youthful beauty." — Ovid, Metamorphoses

name: Sage's Stone
lore: "The sun causes the transformation and conversion of all things, turning one thing into another, one species into another." — The Hermetic Corpus

effect.description: Your team's Overdrive Points regenerate 5% faster
Overdrive Points regeneration speed is increased by an additional 1%
Overdrive Points regeneration speed is increased by an additional 1%
Overdrive Points regeneration speed is increased by an additional 1%
Overdrive Points regeneration speed is increased by an additional 1%
Overdrive Points regeneration speed is increased by an additional 1%

treasures.name: The Voynich Manyscript
treasures.lore: Bookseller Voynich purchased this item in Italy. The letters and language used in the book are unrecognizable, seemingly a reference book for medieval alchemists.

treasures.name: Golden Dawn Emblem
treasures.lore: A symbol of the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn, holding significant status in the history of occultism. Prospective members undergo a rigorous qualification review before proceeding to basic esoteric knowledge training.

treasures.name: Peaceful Mandrake
treasures.lore: "If curses could kill as surely as the mandrake's groan, then I would device some wicked, hair-raising words to burst forth from between my clenched teeth." — Shakespeare, Henry VI

treasures.name: Emerald Tablet
treasures.lore: "As above, so below; by this, the miracle of the One is accomplished. All things are the One, created from the One through differentation." — Emerald Tablet

name: Sealed Magic Bottle
lore: "The fisherman took off his clothes, dove into the water, and struggled to retrieve the net from the sea bottom. Among the catch was a brass jar shaped like a gall bladder, sealed with lead, bearing the seal of Solomon, son of David." — One Thousand and One Nights

effect.description: Reduce incoming damage from the enemy's strongest Luminary by 15% for 15 seconds
The effective targets are changed to 2

treasures.name: Censer of Sleep
treasures.lore: "Walk up to that Vault... Inside are two large censers, burning musk and ambergris... Wisps of smoke, fragrance fills the air, intoxicatingly rich." — One Thousand and One Nights

treasures.name: Arabian Scimitar
treasures.lore: "Thinking of this, he found a knife and managed to pry open the lead seal on the bottle's mouth... A puff of smoke emerged from the bottle growing thicker and thicker, until it formed into a shape, which turned out to be a demon." — One Thousand and One Nights

treasures.name: Seal of Solomon
treasures.lore: "Fisherman, you must know, I am a god of evil heresy, committing all sorts of wicked deeds, and once opposed the great Solomon... So he sent the vizier to conquer me, captured me, and handed me over to him for punishment." — One Thousand and One Nights

name: Sisyphus Monolith
lore: "I saw Sisyphus enduring torture here. Every time the boulder was about to be pushed over the mountain peak, it rolled back down to the flat ground due to its weight. He had to exert himself to push the stone again, drenched in sweat, with dust on his head." — Homer, The Odyssey

effect.description: Increases HP for all allied Luminaries by 3%

treasures.name: Underworld Offering
treasures.lore: "Persephone can return to the heavens, but there is one condition: she must not have tasted any food from the underworld. This is decreed by the Fates, and even the gods cannot defy it." — Ovid, Metamorphoses

treasures.name: Charon's Coin
treasures.lore: "At the ferry of the Styx River, the ferryman Charon is waiting. The spirits crowd towards the riverbank, and Charon ferries those who have been buried across, while the rest must wait a hundred years." — Virgil, The Aeneid

treasures.name: Shackles of Death
treasures.lore: "He suffered this punishment for the sake of the river god's daughter, Aegina, because Zeus secretly took her away, and it is said that he informed the searching river god." — Apollodorus, Library

name: Solomon's Ring
lore: "This book includes an accurate and clear translation of the secret rituals performed by King Solomon. It describes the demons and their sigils. A scholar translated this ancient manuscript." — Solomon's Key

effect.description: Enemy team's Overdrive Points regen slows by 5%
Overdrive Point regeneration speed is reduced by an additional 1%
Overdrive Point regeneration speed is reduced by an additional 1%
Overdrive Point regeneration speed is reduced by an additional 1%
Overdrive Point regeneration speed is reduced by an additional 1%
Overdrive Point regeneration speed is reduced by an additional 1%

treasures.name: Demon Pillar
treasures.lore: "It is said that Solomon summoned some demons while building the temple bearing his name. But after his death, the devils incited the courtiers to seek the seal. Once the seal is shown to the world, it will cause all sorts of chaos." — Solomon's Key

treasures.name: David's Sling
treasures.lore: "David took a stone from his bag, slung it with his sling, and struck the Philistine on the forehead... he fell face down on the ground. Thus, David triumphed over the Philistine with a sling and a stone." — 1 Samuel 17:49

treasures.name: Solomon's Key
treasures.lore: "What kind of fiend have I brought into the house! Fiery eyes, sharp teeth. I know you well! You fledgling devil, I will use the Seal of Solomon to deal with you." — Goethe's Faust

name: Spear of Longinus
lore: The crimson spear is stained with holy blood. It is said that whoever holds this spear will have everyone submit and dominate the fate of the world.

effect.description:
Increase Physical Damage of middle-row Luminary by 15%
[Opening Skill] At the start of the battle, deals 500% Physical Damage of Wyrm Attack to enemy units in a straight line. This skill can trigger the [Punishment] effect. When the [Punishment] effect is triggered, additionally applies [Physical Defense Down].
Middle-row Luminaries Physical Damage increased by an additional 5%
[Opening Skill] Additionally dispels 1 Buff Status from the target
When a middle-row Luminary deals Damage, it ignores 5% of the target's Physical Defense (Stacks up to a maximum of 40%)
Middle-row Luminaries' Physical Damage increased by an additional 5%
The effect range of [Opening Skill] expands to all enemy units

treasures.name: Thirty Pieces of Silver
treasures.lore: The informant chose to betray for thirty pieces of silver. In the end, he committed suicide out of remorse, and the silver pieces were scattered in the temple.

treasures.name: Holy Anointing Oil
treasures.lore: Kings, Priests, and Prophets are anointed with holy oil, the mark of the Holy Spirit's grace poured upon their heads, signifying the divine offices given to them by God.

treasures.name: Tree of Life Stone Slab Shards
treasures.lore: The Tree of Life stands at the center of Paradise. When humanity awakens their desire for perfection, they must follow the path set forth by the Tree of Life.

treasures.name: Thorn Crown
treasures.lore: The Thorn is a symbol of the curse. No one in the world wears a crown of thorns. Only the sufferer bears the torment and pain since the creation.

treasures.name: Centurion's Helmet
treasures.lore: These Centurions are often the backbone of a legion. They charge into battle with red crests on their helmets to demonstrate their bravery.

treasures.name: Dead Sea Scrolls
treasures.lore: Before the temple was destroyed, devout scribes hid the scroll deep within a cave. It was not until a thousand years later that the secrets on the scroll were slowly revealed.

name: Sun God's Cloak
lore: "You ascend to the sky! You shine forth! You make the stars retreat! You are the king of gods, encompassing all, we are born from you, and through you, we become sacred." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

effect.description: Grants the front row Luminary with the highest HP the [Scorching Sun] effect, dealing magic damage equal to 6% of max HP to nearby enemies every 2s. Triggers once every 30s and lasts for 15s
Increases Magic Damage by an additional 2% of max HP
Increases Magic Damage by an additional 2% of max HP
Deal 50% more Damage to enemies affected by [Ignite] Status
Boost max HP by 4% and convert it into Magic Damage
The effective range extends to all our front-row Luminaries
Boost max HP by 4% and convert it into Magic Damage
Healing effects received by enemy units affected by [Scorching Sun] are reduced to 15%

treasures.name: Sun Disk
treasures.lore: "O you god who shines with the light of the sun, you traverse the sky, your miracles surpass any other god. Your breath gives life to mankind, your light illuminates Upper and Lower Egypt." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

treasures.name: Scarab Amulet
treasures.lore: "Ah, you insect that can fly to the sky, you are the god who protects the white crown and the red crown. I am you, and you are me. Please clear the way for me so that I may reach the highest god." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

treasures.name: Ra's Stone Slab
treasures.lore: "I am an untiring oarsman on the sacred boat of Ra. Two sycamore trees form a gateway to thhe eastern sky, and it is through these trees that Ra passes before ascending to the heavens." — Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead

name: Wings of Icarus
lore: "Icarus, I warn you, do not fly too low, for the wings will become heavy with water; nor fly too high, for the sun's heat will burn them." — Ovid

effect.description: Increases Attack for all allied Luminaries by 3%

treasures.name: Ariadne's Thread
treasures.lore: "Take this ball of thread and give it to Theseus. Tell him to tie one end to the door lintel... If he succeeds in killing the monster, he can follow it out." — Apollodorus' Library

treasures.name: Daedalus's Hammer
treasures.lore: "Although he blocked the roads by land and sea, the sky still offers a path. Why not ascend to the heavens? Daedalus pondered how to create an unprecedented mechanism to alter the laws of nature." — Ovid's Metamorphoses

treasures.name: Ship of Theseus
treasures.lore: "Theseus safely returned on a large ship with thirty oars, which the Athenians preserved. They repeatedly dismantled the decayed old planks and replaced them with solid new ones." — Lives of the Noble Grecians and Romans

name: Zeus's Thunder
lore: "After Zeus overthrew his father Cronus with force, he was then ruling the heavens. He possessed lightning and thunder, fairly distributed wealth among the gods, and declared Honor." — Hesiod, Theogony

effect.description: Continuously attacks the enemy Luminary with the lowest HP percentage, dealing 500% of Wyrm's Attack power as Magic Damage. Triggers once every 30s
Deals additional Magic Damage equal to 10% of the target's Max HP

treasures.name: Olive Wreath
treasures.lore: "The statue of Zeus is made of wood, with exposed parts covered in ivory, and the clothing overlaid with gold. On his head is a crown woven from olive branches." — Pausanias, Description of Greece

treasures.name: Status of Nike
treasures.lore: "The main body of the statue of Zeus is made of wood, with exposed parts covered in ivory, and the clothes overlaid with gold... In his right hand, he holds a Statue of Nike made of ivory and gold." — Pausanias, Description of Greece

treasures.name: Eagle Scepter
treasures.lore: "It was laboriously forged by Hephaestus. The god of the forge handed the scepter to the king Zeus, son of Cronus... and then passed it to Agamemnon, who, with the authority of the royal scepter, ruled over many islands." — Homer, The Iliad

treasures.name: Omphalos Stone
treasures.lore: "Goddess Rhea wrapped a large stone in swaddling clothes and gave it to the mighty Ruler, son of the god of heaven, the former kind of gods, Cronus. He took the swaddling clothes and swallowed them." — Hesiod's Theogony
